intro: Leandra subseriata, commonly known as the silverleaf leandra, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, often with a distinctive yellow or orange center. Leandra subseriata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and floral display.
